Package Model

Class Model

java.lang.Object
Model.Model
public class Model
extends java.lang.Object

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Settings themes  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Model()
    Model Constructor: Creates the Board object, a Cell grid and initialize it by filling it with empty Cell objects, a Settings object with all the hex codes for themes, reads scores, like high score and high cell, saved in savedScores.txt, and sets arrow active to false

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addNewCell()
    Uses Random class to find empty spaces on the board and picks a random space to put a new tile calls Cell.setValue(int) to set the value of the new tile to 2, and Cell.setCellColor(Color) method and Settings.getTheme() to get the current theme and color of the tile calls Board.populateTiles(int, int) method to insert Number object into target coordinates in Board object
    boolean ArrowActive()
    Gets the status of arrow
    void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g)
    Draws the Cell objects according to the Cell grid object makes calls to getPreferredSize() method for Dimension object makes calls to Cell.drawCell(Graphics) method to draw cell
    Cell[][] getGrid()
    Gets the 2-Dimensional Cell array
    int getHighCell()
    Gets the highest value on the Board recorded by Model class
    int getModelHighScore()
    Gets the high score recorded by Model class
    java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
    Calculates the view size of the Cell
    int getScore()
    Gets the Score object from Board class
    void initializeGrid()
    Fills 2-Dimensional array of Cell objects with Cell objects of value 1 sets each cell location by making calls to Cell.setCellLocation(int, int) method making calls to Cell.getCellWidth() to set cell location
    boolean isGameOver()
    Checks if the board is full and if there are no more possible moves to be made makes call to Board.isBoardFull() and isMovePossible() methods
    void modelMoveDown()
    Model Move methods: Down makes call to Board.moveDown() method makes call to updateCellGrid() method to update Cell grid with the changes makes call to updateScores() method to record the new scores in Model
    void modelMoveLeft()
    Model Move methods: Left makes call to Board.moveLeft() method makes call to updateCellGrid() method to update Cell grid with the changes makes call to updateScores() method to record the new scores in Model
    void modelMoveRight()
    Model Move methods: Right makes call to Board.moveRight() method makes call to updateCellGrid() method to update Cell grid with the changes makes call to updateScores() method to record the new scores in Model
    void modelMoveUp()
    Model Move methods: Up makes call to Board.moveUp() method makes call to updateCellGrid() method to update Cell grid with the changes makes call to updateScores() method to record the new scores in Model
    void printCellGridandBoard()
    Prints the Cell and Board into the console for debugging
    void resetModel()
    Resets everything similar to constructor except retrieving scores
    void retrieveScores()
    Reads savedScores.txt for high score and highest value of cell from previous games
    void saveGame()
    Saves high score and highest value of cell of the Board in savedScores.txt
    void setArrowActive​(boolean arrowActive)
    Sets the status of arrow
    void setTheme​(int choice)
    Sets the theme of the board
    void updateCellGrid()
    Updates the Cell grid according to the Board object Uses getTileColor(int) method to decode the color from Settings object according to current theme and value of tile Uses Cell.setValue(int) and Cell.setCellColor(Color) to update every Cell object's value and color
    void updateScores()
    Records the high score and highest value of cell from Board class in Model class Uses Board.getGameScore() to retrieve Score object from Board class Uses Score.getHighScore() for high score Uses Board.getHighCell() for highest value of cell from Board

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • themes

      public Settings themes

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model()
      Model Constructor: Creates the Board object, a Cell grid and initialize it by filling it with empty Cell objects, a Settings object with all the hex codes for themes, reads scores, like high score and high cell, saved in savedScores.txt, and sets arrow active to false

  • Method Details

    • resetModel

      public void resetModel()
      Resets everything similar to constructor except retrieving scores

    • setTheme

      public void setTheme​(int choice)
      Sets the theme of the board
      Parameters:
      choice - An integer representing which theme in Settings class

    • getGrid

      public Cell[][] getGrid()
      Gets the 2-Dimensional Cell array
      Returns:
      a 2-Dimensional array of Cell objects

    • getModelHighScore

      public int getModelHighScore()
      Gets the high score recorded by Model class
      Returns:
      An Integer representing the high score recorded by Model class

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Gets the Score object from Board class
      Returns:
      a Score object representing all the scores recorded by Board class

    • getHighCell

      public int getHighCell()
      Gets the highest value on the Board recorded by Model class
      Returns:
      An integer representing the highest value on the Board recorded by Model Class

    • modelMoveUp

      public void modelMoveUp()
      Model Move methods: Up makes call to Board.moveUp() method makes call to updateCellGrid() method to update Cell grid with the changes makes call to updateScores() method to record the new scores in Model

    • modelMoveDown

      public void modelMoveDown()
      Model Move methods: Down makes call to Board.moveDown() method makes call to updateCellGrid() method to update Cell grid with the changes makes call to updateScores() method to record the new scores in Model

    • modelMoveLeft

      public void modelMoveLeft()
      Model Move methods: Left makes call to Board.moveLeft() method makes call to updateCellGrid() method to update Cell grid with the changes makes call to updateScores() method to record the new scores in Model

    • modelMoveRight

      public void modelMoveRight()
      Model Move methods: Right makes call to Board.moveRight() method makes call to updateCellGrid() method to update Cell grid with the changes makes call to updateScores() method to record the new scores in Model

    • initializeGrid

      public void initializeGrid()
      Fills 2-Dimensional array of Cell objects with Cell objects of value 1 sets each cell location by making calls to Cell.setCellLocation(int, int) method making calls to Cell.getCellWidth() to set cell location

    • addNewCell

      public void addNewCell()
      Uses Random class to find empty spaces on the board and picks a random space to put a new tile calls Cell.setValue(int) to set the value of the new tile to 2, and Cell.setCellColor(Color) method and Settings.getTheme() to get the current theme and color of the tile calls Board.populateTiles(int, int) method to insert Number object into target coordinates in Board object

    • draw

      public void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the Cell objects according to the Cell grid object makes calls to getPreferredSize() method for Dimension object makes calls to Cell.drawCell(Graphics) method to draw cell
      Parameters:
      g - A Graphics object

    • getPreferredSize

      public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
      Calculates the view size of the Cell
      Returns:
      A Dimension object with the width and height of the Cell

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the board is full and if there are no more possible moves to be made makes call to Board.isBoardFull() and isMovePossible() methods
      Returns:
      True if game is over, False if can keep going

    • updateCellGrid

      public void updateCellGrid()
      Updates the Cell grid according to the Board object Uses getTileColor(int) method to decode the color from Settings object according to current theme and value of tile Uses Cell.setValue(int) and Cell.setCellColor(Color) to update every Cell object's value and color

    • printCellGridandBoard

      public void printCellGridandBoard()
      Prints the Cell and Board into the console for debugging

    • ArrowActive

      public boolean ArrowActive()
      Gets the status of arrow
      Returns:
      True if Active, False if Not Active

    • setArrowActive

      public void setArrowActive​(boolean arrowActive)
      Sets the status of arrow
      Parameters:
      arrowActive - A boolean value, true is Active, false is Inactive

    • updateScores

      public void updateScores()
      Records the high score and highest value of cell from Board class in Model class Uses Board.getGameScore() to retrieve Score object from Board class Uses Score.getHighScore() for high score Uses Board.getHighCell() for highest value of cell from Board

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame()
      Saves high score and highest value of cell of the Board in savedScores.txt

    • retrieveScores

      public void retrieveScores()
      Reads savedScores.txt for high score and highest value of cell from previous games
